text:
A redesign of the entire TV allocations system will be considered in
the near future.
In the rearrangement of available spectrum space, there are three
major considerations:
1. Adequate television broadcast service must be provided to
the entire nation.
2. The inequity between VHF and UHF assignment must be
rectified.
3. Reasonable provisions must be made for present and future
needs of educational broadcasting.
In view of the well-organized and documented presentations which have
been made on behalf of commercial broadcasting, industry, and the Armed
Services, it is incumbent upon education to state clearly the present and
future needs of education for space in the television spectrum. Such a
statement must be authoritatively documented. We must examine our present
situation and carefully project our future needs. We must know our needs,
and be able to inform the government of those needs in valid terms while
we still have the opportunity.
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters, in cooperation
with the U. S. Office of Education, has undertaken the task of documenting
the needs of education for space in the television spectrum, and will make
an engineering study to support channel allocation claims.
This is an enormous task. We need the help and cooperation of the
entire educational community to conclude this effort successfully.
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
